(TO JUDGE) Appear againl You never saw
a madder man, (POINTING TO DRAPER) and
he is not a whit better. Both are fools.
Between them they haven’t a pennyweight
of brains.
DRAPER
(SHAKING FIST AT PIERRE) You carried it
off by lying—that cloth, I mean-and
without paying for it. Master Pierre.
That was the work of no upright man.
PIERRE
If he isn’t mad already, he is going mad.
DRAPER
I know you by your speech and by your
dress. I am not mad. I am sane enough
to know who does right by me. (TO JUDGE)
I will tell you the whole matter. Upon
